content.webTitle: Rugby union: Henson injury blow for Ospreys and Wales

fields.headline: Henson injury blow for Ospreys and Wales
fields.bodyText: The Wales and Ospreys centre Gavin Henson faces missing the tour to South Africa because of an ankle injury he sustained during the Heineken Cup quarter-final defeat to Saracens a month ago. He will have keyhole surgery tomorrow to assess the extent of the damage having already been ruled out for between four and six weeks. "If the examination reveals clinical instability, then the plan will be to repair the ligament at that time, which would be likely to sideline Gavin for 12 weeks," said the region's physiotherapist, Chris Towers.
